q: no surprise in the Simon Cowell that Rushfield presents, but he does bring him to life-- by turns brilliant and exasperating, self-serving and disarmingly honest. Rushfield sums him up well: If ever a person could be prepared for fame and all that came with it, it was Simon Cowell ... For 20 years, Simon Cowell had been involved in every aspect of the shadowy business of creating stars... He had seen how the magical alchemy could transform people into stars, and he had seen how it could go wrong. decision-making and policy drift, and a detriment to the war effort, the Post said. Donald Rumsfeld suggests that Bush was at fault for not doing more to resolve disagreements among senior advisers. Bush did not always receive, and may not have insisted on, a timely consideration of his options before he made a decision, nor did he always receive effective implementation of the decisions he made, Donald Rumsfeld wrote. Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops for the Iraq war, he wrote: "In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped."

chief Zahi Hawass said Sunday. Seventy artifacts were damaged when looters broke into the world-famous Egyptian Museum, on the edge of Tahrir Square, focal point of an uprising against President Hosni Mubarak 's regime. Restoration has started on the items, including on a statue of King Tutankhamun and a statute of King Akhenaten, Zahi Hawass said. Looters had tried to break open a golden sarcophagus, hoping to find treasures inside, and some skeletons were also damaged, Zahi Hawass said. A gallery displaying King Tut's treasures

hit 7-of-8 shots and was one of three Sixers to score 14 points. The return of Allen Iverson appeared to give Philadelphia a boost. Allen Iverson 's first game since Dec. 16 wasn't easy for the 34-year-old guard. Once Elgin Baylor got my second wind Elgin Baylor was all right. The first couple minutes Elgin Baylor thought my heart was going to jump out of my chest, said Allen Iverson , who in 31 minutes also handed out five assists and collected four rebounds. Debbie Wasserman Schultz told reporters traveling with U.S. Barack Obama after a memorial service in Arizona on Wednesday. Other than the birth of my kids, this was the most incredible feeling to see... one of your closest friends just struggle to come back to you, she said. Debbie Wasserman Schultz and Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand were talking to Gabrielle Giffords in her hospital room shortly after Barack Obama and his wife, Michelle, visited.
